snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s decision to keep New York City schools open drew rebukes from parents, principals and Al Roker, NBC’s “Today” show weatherman.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio’s decision to keep city schools open in snowstorm draws rebukes from parents and principals, who swap tales of stranded buses and mostly empty classrooms; outcry arrives at sensitive moment for mayor, who is facing challenges on many fronts.

byline.contributor:
Reporting on the snow-
storm was contributed by
James Barron, Alan Binder,
Kia Gregory, Emmarie
Huetteman, Ariel Kaminer,
Amisha Padnani, Kate Pas-
tor, Eli M. Rosenberg, Nate
Schweber, Kim Severson,
David Stout and Alex Vadu-
kul.

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s decision to keep New York City schools open drew rebukes from parents, principals and Al Roker, NBC’s “Today” show weatherman.

headline.main: For Mayor, Keeping Schools Open Brings Another Headache
headline.print_headline: Schools Stay Open; Mayor Gets New Headache
